cards.name: Ajani Goldmane
cards.text:
+1: You gain 2 life.
−1: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance until end of turn.
−6: Put a white Avatar creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to your life total."

cards.flavor:
"Until that day I cursed the angels, those uncaring lights in the sky. They rewarded my scorn with the gift of time, every year of which I've spent in devotion to their names."
—Torian Sha, soul warden
cards.name: Angel's Mercy
cards.text: You gain 7 life.

cards.flavor: "The meadow sprang up beneath me, and I perceived a path from our people's defeat to our highest glory."
cards.name: Armored Ascension
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Plains you control and has flying.

cards.flavor: Some angels protect the meek and innocent. Others seek out and smite evil wherever it lurks.
cards.name: Baneslayer Angel
cards.text: Flying, first strike, lifelink, protection from Demons and from Dragons

cards.flavor: "I carry the light of truth. Do not pity those it blinds, for they never had eyes to see."
cards.name: Blinding Mage
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Captain of the Watch
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
When Captain of the Watch enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"We see clearly the error of your ways. It does not matter that you choose not to."
—Urien of the Lightwielders
cards.name: Celestial Purge
cards.text: Exile target black or red permanent.

cards.flavor: Giants and pit spawn attempted to topple the cathedral's pillars. The fine grit of their remains still swirls in the breeze outside.
cards.name: Divine Verdict
cards.text: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.flavor: The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front.
cards.name: Elite Vanguard

cards.flavor:
"Our law prohibits capital punishment. We believe even the gravest offenders have the chance to redeem themselves."
—Torian Sha, soul warden
cards.name: Excommunicate
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor:
"One's blade is only as sharp as one's conviction."
—Ajani Goldmane
cards.name: Glorious Charge
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.
cards.name: Griffin Sentinel
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor: Her gaze prevents the petty sins and her sword punishes the rest.
cards.name: Guardian Seraph
cards.text:
Flying
If a source an opponent controls would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

cards.flavor: Even when fate is already written, there's always time to change the names.
cards.name: Harm's Way
cards.text: The next 2 damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or permanents you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.

cards.flavor:
"Born under the sun, the first child will seek the foundation of honor and be fortified by its righteousness."
—Codex of the Constellari
cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
cards.name: Honor of the Pure
cards.text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Indestructibility
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
Enchanted permanent has indestructible. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy that permanent. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.
cards.name: Lifelink
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Lightwielder Paladin
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Whenever Lightwielder Paladin deals combat damage to a player, you may exile target black or red permanent that player controls.

cards.flavor: She shepherds mysteries and dust as others would a flock of sheep.
cards.name: Mesa Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.flavor: When the vaults are empty, everyone is rich.
cards.name: Open the Vaults
cards.text: Return all artifact and enchantment cards from all graveyards to the battlefield under their owners' control. (Auras with nothing to enchant remain in graveyards.)

cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.flavor: "I'm not nearly as bothered by being outnumbered as I am by their foul stench."
cards.name: Palace Guard
cards.text: Palace Guard can block any number of creatures.

cards.name: Planar Cleansing
cards.text: Destroy all nonland permanents.

cards.flavor: Like a meteor, it strikes from above without warning. Unlike a meteor, it then carries you off and eats you.
cards.name: Razorfoot Griffin
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: When the rhoxes charge, everyone else knows which way to run.
cards.name: Rhox Pikemaster
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Other Soldier creatures you control have first strike.

cards.flavor: Sometimes the greatest strength is the strength of conviction.
cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: With one flap of her wings, the angel beat back the fires of war.
cards.name: Safe Passage
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and creatures you control this turn.

cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.
cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.flavor:
"Defending the citadel is easy. I just take these big fellows outside the main gate and let the enemy take a good long look."
—Mastodon keeper
cards.name: Siege Mastodon

cards.flavor:
"All the wizardry in the world has to pass through one small and easily sealed door."
—Ajani Goldmane
cards.name: Silence
cards.text: Your opponents can't cast spells this turn. (Spells cast before this resolves are unaffected.)

cards.flavor: Hunters of every species on the savannah, silvercoats disdain camouflage in favor of total dominance of the food chain.
cards.name: Silvercoat Lion

cards.flavor:
"A relic donation is suggested."
"The suggestion is mandatory."
—Temple signs
cards.name: Solemn Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain 4 life.

cards.flavor: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."
cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"At summer's end, the pegasus herd stampedes across the sky. Their silent footfalls taunt the clouds and bid the rains to come."
—Stormfront fable
cards.name: Stormfront Pegasus
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "Let everything return to its true nature, so that destiny may take its course."
cards.name: Tempest of Light
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments.

cards.flavor: "My motive is not vengeance but mercy. I deliver the soulless back to their severed souls."
cards.name: Undead Slayer
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Exile target Skeleton, Vampire, or Zombie.

cards.flavor: "Courage is a proud and gleaming shield. It does not bend or hide from sight. To fight with courage, we must forge in steel."
cards.name: Veteran Armorsmith
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.flavor: "Truth is a straight, keen edge. There are no soft angles or rounded edges. To fight for truth, we must forge in steel."
cards.name: Veteran Swordsmith
cards.text: Other Soldier creatures you control get +1/+0.

cards.flavor:
"This is a fine suit, armorsmith. I will be safe from harm. If only you could forge rings to mail the rest of my people . . ."
—Lord Hilneth
cards.name: Wall of Faith
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{W}: Wall of Faith gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: White Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)

cards.flavor:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, The Mirror of the Sea
cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor:
"The ground polluted floats with human gore,
And human carnage taints the dreadful shore
Fly swift the dangerous coast: let every ear
Be stopp'd against the song! 'tis death to hear!"
—Homer, The Odyssey, trans. Pope
cards.name: Alluring Siren
cards.text: {T}: Target creature an opponent controls attacks you this turn if able.

cards.name: Cancel
cards.text: Counter target spell.

cards.flavor: The shapeshifter mimics with a twin's esteem and a mirror's cruelty.
cards.name: Clone
cards.text: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.

cards.flavor: "Where are we? You must learn to ask more useful questions than that."
cards.name: Convincing Mirage
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Convincing Mirage enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

cards.flavor: Merfolk are best known for their subtle magic. But those who try to fight them in their own territory quickly realize that merfolk are hardly defenseless on the field of battle.
cards.name: Coral Merfolk

cards.flavor:
"If it has a brain, even a primitive one, we can most surely scramble it."
—Garild, merfolk mage
cards.name: Disorient
cards.text: Target creature gets -7/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The key to unlocking this puzzle is within you."
—Doriel, mentor of Mistral Isle
cards.name: Divination
cards.text: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Djinn of Wishes
cards.text:
Flying
Djinn of Wishes enters the battlefield with three wish counters on it.
{2}{U}{U}, Remove a wish counter from Djinn of Wishes: Reveal the top card of your library. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, exile it.

cards.flavor: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.
cards.name: Essence Scatter
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.

cards.flavor:
"I'm one masterpiece away from ruling this pathetic world."
—Saldrath, master artificer
cards.name: Fabricate
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Your downfall was not your ignorance, your weakness, or your hubris, but your warm blood."
—Heidar, Rimewind master
cards.name: Flashfreeze
cards.text: Counter target red or green spell.

cards.flavor:
"All consciousness is one, separated only by a thin veil of the physical."
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Hive Mind
cards.text: Whenever a player casts an instant or sorcery spell, each other player copies that spell. Each of those players may choose new targets for his or her copy.

cards.flavor: It's a mistake to say turtles hide in their shells. They merely need time to contemplate how best to bite your head off.
cards.name: Horned Turtle
Ice Cage
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy Ice Cage.

cards.flavor:
"Illusion is a handy but fragile medium. Use it only in a pinch, or against the dim-witted."
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Illusionary Servant
cards.text:
Flying
When Illusionary Servant becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Jace Beleren
cards.text:
+2: Each player draws a card.
−1: Target player draws a card.
−10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Humanity has always envied the power of flight. So we took it."
—Scytha, aeromage
cards.name: Jump
cards.text: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The horses of Scytha's army must be well trained. A thrown rider would fall miles before meeting the ground.
cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.

cards.flavor: Merfolk don't always know what they're looking for, but they're certain once they find it.
cards.name: Merfolk Looter
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.flavor: "The sharks envy our ferocity. The eels envy our cunning."
cards.name: Merfolk Sovereign
cards.text:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Target Merfolk creature can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Mind Control
cards.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.

cards.flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.
cards.name: Mind Spring
cards.text: Draw X cards.

cards.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.
cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.flavor:
"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren
cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

cards.flavor: Tomorrow belongs to those who prepare for it today.
cards.name: Ponder
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Some owls house the souls of archmages of ages past.
cards.name: Sage Owl
cards.text:
Flying
When Sage Owl enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Serpent of the Endless Sea
cards.text:
Serpent of the Endless Sea's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Islands you control.
Serpent of the Endless Sea can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.flavor:
"I give them dreams so wondrous that they hesitate to return to the world of the conscious."
—Garild, merfolk mage
cards.name: Sleep
cards.text: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

cards.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.
cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Sphinx Ambassador
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sphinx Ambassador deals combat damage to a player, search that player's library for a card, then that player names a card. If you searched for a creature card that isn't the named card, you may put it onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor:
"The most disappointing thing about learning telepathy is finding out how boring people really are."
—Teferi, fourth-level student
cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

cards.flavor: Just when you thought you'd survived the first wave.
cards.name: Time Warp
cards.text: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.

cards.flavor: Genius is overrated, especially when it's someone else's.
cards.name: Tome Scour
cards.text: Target player puts the top five cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"The educated mind is heavy with lore and knowledge. It's also the most likely to collapse under its own weight."
—Ambassador Laquatus
cards.name: Traumatize
cards.text: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: Imitation is the most dangerous form of flattery.
cards.name: Twincast
cards.text: Copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.
cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd
cards.name: Wall of Frost
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor: A smaller cousin to the dragon, drakes are often seen at the side of powerful wizards who use them as airborne eyes and ears.
cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: "I've never understood why so many beings lumber around on the ground. There are three dimensions, yet they use only two."
cards.name: Zephyr Sprite
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: Like all priests, she gives her blessings only to those truly worthy of them.
cards.name: Acolyte of Xathrid
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}: Target player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"This is how wars are won—not with armies of soldiers but with a single knife blade, artfully placed."
—Yurin, royal assassin
cards.name: Assassinate
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

cards.flavor: She died in this swamp, and so will you.
cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.flavor: Every grave cradles a recruit.
cards.name: Cemetery Reaper
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures you control get +1/+1.
{2}{B}, {T}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: A vampire enacts vengeance on the entire world, claiming her debt two tiny pinpricks at a time.
cards.name: Child of Night
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life.

cards.flavor: Even the noblest of intentions and strongest of wills inevitably crumble into dust.
cards.name: Deathmark
cards.text: Destroy target green or white creature.

cards.flavor: The wise always keep an ear open to the whispers of power.
cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:
"Stop complaining. You can rest when you're dead. Oh—sorry."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Disentomb
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The void is without substance but cuts like steel.
cards.name: Doom Blade
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature.

cards.flavor: "I don't know who to pity more: those who flee from my presence or the damned who can withstand it."
cards.name: Dread Warlock
cards.text: Dread Warlock can't be blocked except by black creatures.

cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor:
"Don't worry. I'm not going to deprive you of all your secrets. Just your most precious one."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Duress
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.flavor: Oddly, no one questioned the Cabal's wisdom in hiring a zombie to work at the cemetery.
cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Haunting Echoes
cards.text: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard other than basic land cards. For each card exiled this way, search that player's library for all cards with the same name as that card and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: Villagers cloaked the town in magical silence, but their ears still bled.
cards.name: Howling Banshee
cards.text:
Flying
When Howling Banshee enters the battlefield, each player loses 3 life.

cards.flavor: Its victims are known by their eyes: shattered vessels leaking broken dreams.
cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.flavor: The nesting bats of Kelinore sleep soundly while the sun passes, nestled among their grisly collections.
cards.name: Kelinore Bat
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Liliana Vess
cards.text:
+1: Target player discards a card.
−2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
−8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: Its form never rests, propelled by some undetectable gale from beyond the gloom.
cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath
cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.

cards.flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.
cards.name: Mind Shatter
cards.text: Target player discards X cards at random.

cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.
cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Relentless Rats
cards.text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

cards.flavor:
"Death is no excuse for disobedience."
—Liliana Vess
cards.name: Rise from the Grave
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. That creature is a black Zombie in addition to its other colors and types.

cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.
cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.flavor:
"Blood is constant. Every drop I drink, someone must bleed."
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus
cards.name: Sanguine Bond
cards.text: Whenever you gain life, target opponent loses that much life.

cards.flavor:
"You know I accept only one currency here, and yet you have sought me out. Why now do you hesitate?"
—Xathrid demon
cards.name: Sign in Blood
cards.text: Target player draws two cards and loses 2 life.

cards.flavor: Whether the end comes swift or slow, it always comes too soon.
cards.name: Soul Bleed
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: Darkness doesn't always send its minions to do its dirty work.
cards.name: Tendrils of Corruption
cards.text: Tendrils of Corruption deals X damage to target creature and you gain X life, where X is the number of Swamps you control.

cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore
cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.flavor:
"Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari
cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.flavor: "I admit, I am a creature of the city. The sights, the nightly excitement, the abundance of fine drink . . ."
cards.name: Vampire Aristocrat
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Vampire Aristocrat gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Your life will set with the sun."
cards.name: Vampire Nocturnus
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
As long as the top card of your library is black, Vampire Nocturnus and other Vampire creatures you control get +2/+1 and have flying.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor: The battle was over, but the carnage continued for days.
cards.name: Warpath Ghoul

cards.flavor: "For strength to have any meaning, there must also be . . . you."
cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Xathrid Demon
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Xathrid Demon, then each opponent loses life equal to the sacrificed creature's power. If you can't sacrifice a creature, tap Xathrid Demon and you lose 7 life.

cards.flavor:
"Phirax of Blood Ridge has sent a war giant at us? What, do I have to spell it out for you? Kill the giant, scoop out its skull, and drive it back to Blood Ridge. Honestly, what kind of necromancer minions are you?"
—Keren-Dur, necromancer lord
cards.name: Zombie Goliath

cards.flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Act of Treason
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

cards.flavor: They take a blood oath to die in battle. So far none have failed to fulfill the promise.
cards.name: Berserkers of Blood Ridge
cards.text: Berserkers of Blood Ridge attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Bogardan Hellkite
cards.text:
Flash
Flying
When Bogardan Hellkite enters the battlefield, it deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.flavor: Jariad burned the midnight oil, burned through scroll after scroll, and then burned down his laboratory.
cards.name: Burning Inquiry
cards.text: Each player draws three cards, then discards three cards at random.

cards.flavor: Great generals inspire by example. Goblin chieftains inspire by electrifying the barracks.
cards.name: Burst of Speed
cards.text: Creatures you control gain haste until end of turn. (They can attack and {T} even if they just came under your control.)

cards.flavor:
"We'll scale these cliffs, traverse Brittle Bridge, and then fight our way down the volcanic slopes on the other side."
"Isn't the shortest route through the canyon?"
"Yes."
"So shouldn't we—"
"No."
cards.name: Canyon Minotaur

cards.flavor: "You wish for great destruction? It is done, my master."
cards.name: Capricious Efreet
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, choose target nonland permanent you control and up to two target nonland permanents you don't control. Destroy one of them at random.

cards.name: Chandra Nalaar
cards.text:
+1: Chandra Nalaar deals 1 damage to target player.
−X: Chandra Nalaar deals X damage to target creature.
−8: Chandra Nalaar deals 10 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.

cards.name: Dragon Whelp
cards.text:
Flying
{R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: They fell screaming into the depths of the chasm like so many pebbles tossed down a well.
cards.name: Earthquake
cards.text: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.flavor: Once a barbarian army has conquered a region, their shamans summon hellhounds that keep undesirables out and prisoners in.
cards.name: Fiery Hellhound
cards.text: {R}: Fiery Hellhound gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

cards.flavor: The mage breathed in life-giving air and breathed out death-bringing fire.
cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Most goblins get their turn firing the catapult, but few achieve the coveted title of Ammunition Holder.
cards.name: Goblin Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Goblin Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.

cards.flavor: "We are goblinkind, heirs to the mountain empires of chieftains past. Rest is death to us, and arson is our call to war."
cards.name: Goblin Chieftain
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 and have haste.

cards.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.
cards.name: Goblin Piker

cards.flavor: The shaman prowled the academy halls, shaking his head at the pomp and babble of the sages inside. He knew just the spell to liven the place up.
cards.name: Ignite Disorder
cards.text: Ignite Disorder deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target white and/or blue creatures.

cards.flavor:
"Those who wish to invade our monastery, please take it up with my servant."
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.name: Inferno Elemental
cards.text: Whenever Inferno Elemental blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Inferno Elemental deals 3 damage to that creature.

cards.flavor:
"Let the gray-hairs keep their ravens and drakes. My familiar will be a reflection of me: bloodthirsty, with a predator's instinct."
—Taivang, barbarian warlord
cards.name: Jackal Familiar
cards.text: Jackal Familiar can't attack or block alone.

cards.flavor:
"Rage is a dangerous weapon. Your enemies will try to use your anger against you. Use it against them first."
—Ajani Goldmane
cards.name: Kindled Fury
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.
cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"
cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Magma Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
When Magma Phoenix dies, it deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
{3}{R}{R}: Return Magma Phoenix from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter
cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor:
"What do they see in the throes of panic? I'm not sure I want to know."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer
cards.name: Panic Attack
cards.text: Up to three target creatures can't block this turn.

cards.flavor: "What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man."
cards.name: Prodigal Pyromancer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Who'd want to ignite things one at a time?"
—Chandra Nalaar
cards.name: Pyroclasm
cards.text: Pyroclasm deals 2 damage to each creature.

cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.flavor:
"Life up here is simple. Adapt to the ways of the mountains and they will reward you. Fight them and they will end you."
—Kezim, prodigal pyromancer
cards.name: Seismic Strike
cards.text: Seismic Strike deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

cards.flavor: Days of planning. Weeks of building. Months of perfecting. Seconds of smashing.
cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.
cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Siege-Gang Commander
cards.text:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: Sparkmages are performance artists of sorts, but pain is the price of admission.
cards.name: Sparkmage Apprentice
cards.text: When Sparkmage Apprentice enters the battlefield, it deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: A typical day for a giant. A momentous event for a goat.
cards.name: Stone Giant
cards.text: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Keldon warriors don't need signals to tell them when to attack. They need signals to tell them when to stop.
cards.name: Trumpet Blast
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Viashino lack the majesty of their draconic ancestors, but they lash out with equal rage and twice the spite.
cards.name: Viashino Spearhunter
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.flavor: Mercy is for those who keep their distance.
cards.name: Wall of Fire
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Warp World
cards.text: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of his or her library.

cards.flavor: The mapmaker scowled. He sighed, unrolled his parchment, and painted a large black blob where the Eternal Meadow was once marked.
cards.name: Yawning Fissure
cards.text: Each opponent sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Acidic Slime
cards.text:
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
When Acidic Slime enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.

cards.flavor:
"Kill the queen first, or we'll be fighting her drones forever. It is not in a queen's nature to have enough servants."
—Borzard, exterminator captain
cards.name: Ant Queen
cards.text: {1}{G}: Put a 1/1 green Insect creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The druids of Mazar treat each seedcone with respect for the warrior it will become.
cards.name: Awakener Druid
cards.text: When Awakener Druid enters the battlefield, target Forest becomes a 4/5 green Treefolk creature for as long as Awakener Druid remains on the battlefield. It's still a land.

cards.flavor: Each feather in its tail is a souvenir of an exotic land, a memory condensed in hue.
cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: "Only fools and bandits use roads."
cards.name: Borderland Ranger
cards.text: When Borderland Ranger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: Following the sun's cycle, harvest season comes once a year—unless the druids bid the sun behave otherwise.
cards.name: Bountiful Harvest
cards.text: You gain 1 life for each land you control.

cards.flavor:
"I've seen the fully grown ones tear a baloth to gory ribbons in seconds."
—Kivi, thornberry harvester
cards.name: Bramble Creeper
cards.text: Whenever Bramble Creeper attacks, it gets +5/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The centaurs are truly free. Never will they be tamed by temptation or controlled by fear. They live in total harmony, a feat not yet achieved by our kind."
—Ramal, sage of Westgate
cards.name: Centaur Courser

cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.
cards.name: Craw Wurm
Cudgel Troll
cards.text: {G}: Regenerate Cudgel Troll. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Deadly Recluse
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: He knows the name of every elf born in the last four centuries. More importantly, they all know his.
cards.name: Elvish Archdruid
cards.text:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool for each Elf you control.

cards.flavor:
From Gaea grew the world, and the world was silent. From Gaea grew the world's elves, and the world was silent no more.
—Elvish teaching
cards.name: Elvish Piper
cards.text: {G}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.
cards.name: Elvish Visionary
cards.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.flavor: After the oryx dies, its flesh returns to the earth, but its emerald bones remain as a tribute to the forest.
cards.name: Emerald Oryx
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

cards.flavor: Its diet consists of fruits, plants, small woodland animals, large woodland animals, woodlands, fruit groves, fruit farmers, and small cities.
cards.name: Enormous Baloth

cards.flavor: Every living thing has roots in nature. Sometimes nature gets its roots into you.
cards.name: Entangling Vines
cards.text:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.flavor:
"I fear no army or beast, but only the morning fog. Our assault can survive everything else."
—Lord Hilneth
cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.text:
+1: Untap two target lands.
−1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
−4: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.
cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Ineffable and incorruptible.
cards.name: Great Sable Stag
cards.text:
Great Sable Stag can't be countered.
Protection from blue and from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything blue or black.)

cards.flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.
cards.name: Howl of the Night Pack
cards.text: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield for each Forest you control.

cards.flavor:
"Do not fire upon it—it is bad luck. And a waste of arrows."
—Alera Benath, Kalonian ranger
cards.name: Kalonian Behemoth
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: All are prey to the eyes of the wild.
cards.name: Lurking Predators
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, you may put that card on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Master of the Wild Hunt
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}: Tap all untapped Wolf creatures you control. Each Wolf tapped this way deals damage equal to its power to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power divided as its controller chooses among any number of those Wolves.

cards.flavor:
May your weapon be no sword forged. May your armor be no metal wrought.
—Elvish saying
cards.name: Might of Oaks
cards.text: Target creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"I can't claim to hunt all creatures. There are some things in the jungle that simply can't be hunted."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.name: Mist Leopard
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: The more you struggle against its coils, the tighter they get.
cards.name: Mold Adder
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Mold Adder.

cards.flavor: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.
cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.flavor: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.
cards.name: Nature's Spiral
cards.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand. (A permanent card is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card.)

cards.flavor:
"When the beast cloaks itself in the mighty oak, what good is a bow? When the oak wraps itself around the snarling beast, what good is a hatchet?"
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
cards.name: Oakenform
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

cards.name: Overrun
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The desire for its magic horn inspires such bloodthirsty greed that all who see the unicorn will kill to possess it."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
cards.name: Prized Unicorn
cards.text: All creatures able to block Prized Unicorn do so.

cards.name: Protean Hydra
cards.text:
Protean Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
If damage would be dealt to Protean Hydra, prevent that damage and remove that many +1/+1 counters from it.
Whenever a +1/+1 counter is removed from Protean Hydra, put two +1/+1 counters on it at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.
cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.flavor: "This wound shall be like the chills of winter: swiftly forgotten when spring shoots rise."
cards.name: Regenerate
cards.text: Regenerate target creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.flavor: Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.
cards.name: Runeclaw Bear

cards.flavor:
"Sometimes I wonder if our weapons and armor are a step backward."
—Soron, rhox pikemaster
cards.name: Stampeding Rhino
cards.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.flavor:
"We don't like interlopers and thieves cluttering our skies."
—Dionus, elvish archdruid
cards.name: Windstorm
cards.text: Windstorm deals X damage to each creature with flying.

cards.flavor: If taken, it cuts the hand that clutches it. If given, it heals the hand that holds it.
cards.name: Angel's Feather
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.
cards.name: Coat of Arms
cards.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)

cards.name: Darksteel Colossus
cards.text:
Trample, indestructible
If Darksteel Colossus would be put into a graveyard from anywhere, reveal Darksteel Colossus and shuffle it into its owner's library instead.

cards.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.
cards.name: Demon's Horn
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.
cards.name: Dragon's Claw
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Gorgon Flail
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: The mine's riches never end, nor do the moans of the spirits doomed to haunt them.
cards.name: Howling Mine
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

cards.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.
cards.name: Kraken's Eye
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Magebane Armor
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +2/+4 and loses flying.
Prevent all noncombat damage that would be dealt to equipped creature.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: As the glass shattered, forgotten realities and dead memories came flooding back.
cards.name: Mirror of Fate
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Mirror of Fate: Choose up to seven face-up exiled cards you own. Exile all the cards from your library, then put the chosen cards on top of your library.

cards.flavor: Regardless of the century, plane, or species, developing artificers never fail to invent the ornithopter.
cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.flavor: It disables with pinpoint accuracy.
cards.name: Pithing Needle
cards.text:
As Pithing Needle enters the battlefield, name a card.
Activated abilities of sources with the chosen name can't be activated unless they're mana abilities.

cards.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.
cards.name: Platinum Angel
cards.text:
Flying
You can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.

cards.flavor:
"My masterpiece is complete—and so shall be my triumph."
—Saldrath, master artificer
cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Everything the wise woman learned she wrote in a book, and when the pages were black with ink, she took white ink and began again."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.name: Spellbook
cards.text: You have no maximum hand size.

cards.name: Whispersilk Cloak
cards.text:
Equipped creature can't be blocked and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.
cards.name: Wurm's Tooth
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Dragonskull Summit
cards.text:
Dragonskull Summit enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Drowned Catacomb
cards.text:
Drowned Catacomb enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Most knew of the tower's wizard and gargoyle. Few realized which was guardian and which was master.
cards.name: Gargoyle Castle
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{5}, {T}, Sacrifice Gargoyle Castle: Put a 3/4 colorless Gargoyle artifact creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Glacial Fortress
cards.text:
Glacial Fortress enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or an Island.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rootbound Crag
cards.text:
Rootbound Crag enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Mountain or a Forest.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Sunpetal Grove
cards.text:
Sunpetal Grove enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Forest or a Plains.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Terramorphic Expanse
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Terramorphic Expanse: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
